case_title: ALI AND 3 OTHERS vs THE STATE
case_number: Criminal Appeal No. 237 and Confirmation Case No. 60 of 1967

key_points.description: The appellants were related and had a history of blood feuds with the complainant party.
The prosecution alleged that the appellants committed murder during a nighttime attack.
Eyewitness testimony was inconsistent and lacked credibility.
The plea of alibi raised by Arbab and Ramzan was supported by police station diary entries but was rejected by the trial court.
The recovery of firearms and other evidence was deemed unreliable due to procedural flaws.
The court found the prosecution's case insufficient to establish guilt beyond reasonable doubt.

final_decision.description: The appellants were acquitted of all charges and their convictions and sentences were set aside.
final_decision.details: The death sentences for Durro and Arbab were not confirmed. Any fines paid were ordered to be refunded.
